intro: Phanera griffithiana, commonly known as the Griffith's phanera, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
